question.title: How to enter double and string alternately in an infinite loop?
question.body:
I'm trying to write a calculator In Java, but I don't understand how to provide infinite input of double and string in turn. It keeps throwing InputMismatchException, I don't know what to do.


public class Calculate{
    private static boolean stopper = true;
    private static double result;

    public static void calculate(Scanner scanner){
        while (stopper){
            try {
                double a = scanner.nextDouble();
                String symbol = scanner.nextLine();
                if (symbol.equals("=")){
                    stopper = false;
                    System.out.println(result);
                }else if (symbol.equals("+")){
                    result += a;
                }
            } catch (InputMismatchException e) {
                System.out.println("Неправильный ввод данных");
                break;
            }
        }
    }
}

answers.body:
So it will accept NaN for infinite. However, it appears it is localization specific. For example for US-EN this will work:

import java.util.*;
import java.io.*;

class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        StringReader reader = new StringReader("-1.0\n4.3\nNaN\n");
        Scanner scanner = new Scanner(reader);
        while(true) {
            Double d = scanner.nextDouble();
            System.out.println("value = " + d);
        }
    }
}

And the output:

value = -1.0
value = 4.3
value = NaN
ERROR!
Exception in thread "main" java.util.NoSuchElementException
    at java.base/java.util.Scanner.throwFor(Scanner.java:945)
    at java.base/java.util.Scanner.next(Scanner.java:1602)
    at java.base/java.util.Scanner.nextDouble(Scanner.java:2573)
    at Main.main(Main.java:11)

79536459.body: NaN is not Infinity, and this answer is based on a misunderstanding of what OP is asking.
I think they are asking how to read double/string/double in an infinite loop. See their earlier post: stackoverflow.com/q/79536313/669576
